intro: Cieca pannosa, commonly known as the silky cieca, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
